business.headline: Paytm gets approval from National Payments Corporation to onboard new UPI usersThe approval is subject to adherence to all NPCI procedural guidelines and circulars, including guidelines and circulars issued specifically on risk management, brand guidelines for app and QR, multi-bank guidelines, among others.

Reliance-Disney merger approved, parties agree not to bundle cricket ad slotsA detailed order approving the mega media assets merger of Reliance Industries and Walt Disney was published by the Competition Commission of India on Tuesday.

IMF holds India's GDP growth steady at 7% for FY25, 6.5% for FY26The International Monetary Fund (IMF) suggests that the initial demand surge following the pandemic is now easing, with the economy returning to a more normal state.

Worried AI might replace you? This survey will change your mindThe latest findings from Adecco Group's 'Global Workforce of the Future 2024' report offer a contrasting view of how artificial intelligence (AI) is influencing workplaces, compared to common perceptions.

Not just smog but onions too will leave you teary-eyed this DiwaliOnions are currently selling for Rs 60-80 per kg in retail markets, and the impact of weather disruptions is likely to keep prices elevated.

Zomato Q2 results: Profit soars 389% to Rs 176 crore, revenue jumps 68%Zomato Q2 results: The strong bottom-line performance can be attributed to rising food delivery margins and the quick commerce segment, which is nearing break-even.

Stock market meltdown: Why Sensex tanked over 900 points todayStock market today: At the closing bell, Sensex plunged 930.55 points to 80,220.72, while the Nifty fell 309 points to 24,472.10. The sharp decline wiped out over Rs 9 lakh crore in the BSE's market capitalisation, leaving many investors reeling.

Opposition's charge against Sebi chief false: Government sourcesSerious allegations of conflict of interest and financial misconduct were levelled against the Sebi chief by US short-seller Hindenburg Research and the Congress party.

Ambuja Cement acquires Orient Cements for Rs 8,100 crore. Details here Ambuja Cement aims to increase its cement production capacity to 100 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) by FY25, with the acquisition adding about 30 MTPA to its total.

Paytm share price plunges 7% despite Q2 profit growth. Here's whyPaytm share price today: The digital payment firm's share price plunged sharply despite the company posting a net profit in the second quarter of the ongoing financial year.

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Hyundai IPO set for muted stock market debut on BSE, NSEHyundai India Share Price Listing: The IPO, which opened on October 15, faced a slow start, particularly from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM's bilateral with China's Xi at Brics Summit today, days after border truce Live UpdatesThis is PM Modi and Xi Jinping's first formal meeting in five years and also comes just days after India said it reached a truce with China to resume patrolling in disputed areas along the LAC in eastern Ladakh, ending a four-year military standoff.

5 dead, many trapped as under-construction building collapses in BengaluruAn under-construction building collapsed in Bengaluru amid heavy rain in the city, in which five people have died. Several others are feared trapped as rescue operations are underway.

Meaningful accountability from India in Pannun murder plot probe, says USThe latest remarks come a week after State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said that Washington was "satisfied" following a meeting with an Indian inquiry committee set up to probe the Pannun case.

Maha Vikas Aghadi finalises seat-sharing for Maharashtra polls: SourcesThe Congress is likely to contest 104, Uddhav Thackeray's Sena will be allotted 96 seats, and Sharad Pawar's NCP is expected to field candidates in 88 constituencies, sources said.
Are you drinking too much... water?Drinking water and staying hydrated is beneficial, but drinking too much water can pose risks to your health, potentially leading to water intoxication.

McDonald's burgers tied to E Coli outbreak in US that killed 1, sickened dozensThe E coli outbreak, linked to one of McDonald's most popular menu items, has killed one person and at least 49 people were reportedly sick after eating the Quarter Pounder hamburger.

Cyclone Dana: Odisha, Bengal begin evacuations, over 30 rescue teams on standby LIVE UPDATESCyclone Dana Update: 20 NDRF teams in Odisha and 14 teams in West Bengal are on standby and educational institutions have been shut, as Cyclone Dana will likely make landfall in Odisha's Puri and Bengal's Sagar Island on Thursday evening.

Priyanka Gandhi to file nomination for Wayanad bypolls today, mark political debut Live UpdatesPriyanka Gandhi has been pitted against the BJP's Navya Haridas and senior Communist Party of India (CPI) leader Sathyan Mokeri in the Wayanad Lok Sabha bye-election slated to take place on November 13.

Video: Worker rescued after under-construction building collapses in BengaluruFive people died after an under construction building collapsed in Hennur area in Bengaluru amid heavy rain in the city on Tuesday. Several others are still trapped under the debris of the building. This video shows the rescue personnel rescuing a worker trapped under the debris of the building.

Dance group Quick Style reviews Virat Kohli's moves after viral collaborationQuick Style members reviewed Virat Kohli's dance moves after their collaboration from last year, which sent the fans into frenzy. The members said that Kohli was really down to earth and danced more than they expected.

No point sugarcoating, Sarfaraz and KL Rahul fighting for a spot: DoeschateSpeaking to the press in the lead-up to the second Test in Pune, India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said India have a healthy headache when it comes to their batting unit. He said Sarfaraz Khan and KL Rahul are fighting for the No. 6 spot in the XI. Shubman Gill, who missed the first Test due to a stiff neck, will return to the second Test in Pune, starting October 24.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
